sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Find the rank of the following matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
2 & 4 & 6 \\
-1 & 1 & 2 
\end{bmatrix}
$$
message_2:
To find the rank of the matrix, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to put the matrix in row-echelon form and then count the number of non-zero rows.

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
2 & 4 & 6 \\
-1 & 1 & 2 
\end{bmatrix}
\rightarrow
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 3 & 5 
\end{bmatrix}
\rightarrow
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 3 & 5 \\
0 & 0 & 0 
\end{bmatrix}
$$

The matrix is now in row-echelon form, and we can see that there are 2 non-zero rows. Therefore, the rank of the matrix is 2.
